benchmark_details.name: PG-CE (Progressive Generation Dataset with Constraint Enhancement)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper proposes the PG-CE approach, designed for Controllable Text Generation (CTG), which decomposes CTG tasks into three steps: type prediction, constraint construction, and guided generation. The paper presents a dataset containing 90,000 constraint-text pairs tailored to real-world applications.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance controllability and practicality in text generation tasks through a structured approach using constraints.

data.source: Constructed from various publicly available datasets including Alpaca-GPT4, ShareGPT, ChatCounselor, MedDialog, DISC-Law-SFT, and others.
data.annotation: Data was screened for quality, removing duplicates and ensuring relevancy and clarity.

methods: Hierarchical design strategy for constraint generation
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the effectiveness of control strategies and overall generation output.
methodology.interpretation: Lower toxicity scores indicate better performance in generating safe and relevant content.
methodology.validation: Validated through experimental setups using toxic prompts and various comparison benchmarks.
